snippet: Gazprom, the Russian energy company, increased the price by 44 percent even as American and Russian diplomats worked toward a settlement over Ukraine.
abstract: Russian energy company Gazprom increase price it charges for natural gas by 44 percent, raising economic pressures on Ukraine even as American and Russian diplomats work toward settlement; Aleksei B Miller, Gazprom's chief executive, attributes price increase to unpaid debt for gas, making no mention of revolution in Ukraine.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Kiev, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: Gazprom, the Russian energy company, increased the price by 44 percent even as American and Russian diplomats worked toward a settlement over Ukraine.

headline.main: Russia Tightens Pressure on Ukraine With Rise in Natural Gas Price
headline.print_headline: Russia Tightens Pressure on Ukraine With Rise in Natural Gas Price
